TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ActivityToolboxItem extends System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides a base class for all toolbox items associated with an activity in a workflow designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
All toolbox items associated with an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> class are derived from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem>. This class displays a graphical representation of an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> class in the toolbox of a design-time environment and creates an instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> class it is associated with when a user drags it onto the design surface. The activity toolbox item typically represents an activity to create when invoked on a design-mode document.
This class inherits directly from the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class.
## Examples The following example shows a complete <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem> class for a custom activity. In this example, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method is overridden in order to place 2 custom activities within a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ParallelActivity>.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#70](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#70)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#70](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#70)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks When <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem.%23ctor%2A> is called, it deserializes the toolbox item.
## Examples The following example shows a complete <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem> class for a custom activity. The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Deserialize%2A> method is called within the constructor in order to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem>.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#70](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#70)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#70](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#70)]

Docs.param: The to host the toolbox item.
Docs.summary: Creates an component or an array of components when the toolbox item is invoked.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method returns the component or components that the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem> creates.
## Examples The following example shows a complete <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem> class for a custom activity. In this example, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method is overridden in order to insert 2 custom activities within a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ParallelActivity>.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#70](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets.cs#70)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#70](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets.vb#70)]

abstract member CreateComponentsWithUI : System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost -> System.ComponentModel.IComponent[] override this.CreateComponentsWithUI : System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost -> System.ComponentModel.IComponent[]

Docs.param: The to host the toolbox item.
Docs.summary: Creates an component or an array of components that generate a dialog box on the design surface when the toolbox item is invoked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Activity designer developers can override this method to display a dialog box when the toolbox item is dragged onto the design surface. Unless overridden, this method has the same behavior as <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A>.
